title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:
Um... not really...
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

I guess. They are kind of set up the same and use similar colors... But you can definitely tell between one and the other. But if you compare the actual notes themselves... for example the 20 and the 20s look completely different.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content: I'm pretty sure most money is colorful with people on it. Except American. Who chose those colors? Green and beige?? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:
My vote goes to no. They're not similar enough to confuse them, at least.

However, the 5, 10 and 20 cent pieces are almost identical, and often turn up amongst my change.

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:
Our American money is so boring compared to the rest of the world's. Every country I've been to seems to have money that's more interesting to look at and has more than two colors on it.

But as to the topic of this post, I think that they're sufficiently different to avoid confusion.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:
Yeah, agree with Djaser. They're different, and they're not. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]

Why this topic? Are you going to try money fraud with the other country's currency? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Resemblance between the Australian & Kiwi dollars?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]However, the 5, 10 and 20 cent pieces are almost identical, and often turn up amongst my change.[hr][/quote]

The same with US / Canadian coins. The lower values look the same. Here, it's still a rare sight to see because we are... farther away from the border but I have found people giving me pennies and dimes that on close inspection, were not US currency. (But who really friggin cares?! It's 10 cents.)-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.
